whatistedxberkeley.title: What is TEDxBerkeley?
whatistedxberkeley.copy: On February 6, 2016 TEDxBerkeley is gathering world-leading thinkers, makers, and doers at UC Berkeley to discuss “Finding x.”. The audience will be composed of a diverse mix of over 1500 students, professors, and thought leaders from Berkeley and beyond for a stimulating day of presentations, discussions, entertainment and art that will spark new ideas and opportunities for all.

abouttedx.title: About TEDx, x = independently organized event
abouttedx.copy: In the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. At a TEDx event, TEDTalks video and live speakers combine to spark deep discussion and connection in a small group. These local, self-organized events are branded TEDx, where x = independently organized TED event. The TED Conference provides general guidance for the TEDx program, but individual TEDx events are self-organized. (Subject to certain rules and regulations.)

aboutted.title: About TED
aboutted.copy:
TED is a nonprofit organization devoted to Ideas Worth Spreading. Started as a four-day conference in California 25 years ago, TED has grown to support those world-changing ideas with multiple initiatives. The annual TED Conference invites the world’s leading thinkers and doers to speak for 18 minutes. Their talks are then made available, free, at TED.com. TED speakers have included Bill Gates, Al Gore, Jane Goodall, Elizabeth Gilbert, Sir Richard Branson, Nandan Nilekani, Philippe Starck, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, Isabel Allende and former UK Prime Minister Gordon Brown. The annual TED Conference takes place each spring in Long Beach, California, along with the TEDActive simulcast in Palm Springs; the annual TEDGlobal conference is held each summer in Edinburgh, Scotland.

TED’s media initiatives include TED.com, where new TEDTalks are posted daily, the recently launched TED-Ed platform for students and educators, the Open Translation Project, which provides subtitles and interactive transcripts as well as the ability for any TEDTalk to be translated by volunteers worldwide, and TEDBooks, short e-books by speakers that elaborate on a single idea originally presented on TED’s stage. TED has established the annual TED Prize, where exceptional individuals with a wish to change the world are given the opportunity to put their wishes into action; TEDx, which offers individuals or groups a way to host local, self-organized events around the world, and the TED Fellows program, helping world-changing innovators from around the globe to become part of the TED community and, with its help, amplify the impact of their remarkable projects and activities. Follow TED on Twitter or on Facebook.

Follow TED on Twitter at twitter.com/TEDTalks, or on Facebook at facebook.com/TED.

getthemostout.title: Arrive early
getthemostout.copy: We encourage you to arrive at 9AM, an hour before the first speaker sessions begin. Arriving early means you’ll be able to network with other incredible thinkers and doers.

getthemostout.title: Stay until the very end.
getthemostout.copy: We recommend you plan to stay through the farewell party  – until at least 7PM. TEDxBerkeley is an unusual conference in that our attendees stay for its entirety — every session and special event, right up through the Farewell Party.

getthemostout.title: Clear your calendar. No, really.
getthemostout.copy: To help you get the most out of TEDxBerkeley, we ask that you lend us your brain. Ignore your email. Switch off your phone. Don’t take meetings. TED is an immersive experience, and you won’t want to miss a moment.

getthemostout.title: Talk to strangers.
getthemostout.copy: TEDxBerkeley is teeming with amazing people. Most speakers stay all day long, and the attendees, in truth, are every bit as extraordinary. As a result, chance encounters at TEDxBerkeley often lead to new ideas, projects, perspectives, companies … They’re as essential to the experience as the program itself.

getthemostout.title: Don’t miss a thing.
getthemostout.copy: Watch every session. Go to every event. The best TED moments happen when you least expect them. It’s invariably the unknown speakers who wow the crowd. Watching every session helps you avoid disappointment, and ensures you take in each key moment as it happens. Social events, too, are there for a reason.

getthemostout.title: Leave your laptop at home. And your cell phone in your bag.
getthemostout.copy: The speakers at TEDxBerkeley merit your full attention, and laptops and cell phones are a big distraction – not just for you, but for everyone around you. To preserve an immersive experience, we don’t allow cell phone use in the theater. Blogging is permitted from the back row and the balcony, and is welcomed in the social spaces.

getthemostout.title: Let us help you.
getthemostout.copy: Our staff will do their best to answer any questions and solve any problems, from logistics queries to laptop breakdowns. Pre-conference, contact us via email at info@tedxberkeley.org. On-site, visit our concierge at the registration desk, or ask anyone wearing a Staff badge.

getthemostout.title: Share your experience with others.
getthemostout.copy: If you plan to blog, take photos, or Twitter, use these tags: #TEDxBerkeley, #TEDx. Take pictures, share your TEDxBerkeley memories with friends and family during and after the event.

faq.title: What is TED?
faq.copy: TED is an annual event where the world’s leading thinkers and doers are invited to share their passions. “TED” stands for Technology, Entertainment, Design – three broad subject areas that are shaping our future.

faq.title: TEDx?
faq.copy: In the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TEDx is a program of local, self-organised events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. These local, self-organised events are branded TEDx, where x = independently organised TED event.

faq.title: TEDxBerkeley?
faq.copy: Started in 2010 and hosted on the UC Berkeley campus, TEDxBerkeley is one of the largest TEDx events in the world, featuring over 1200 attendees every year. TEDxBerkeley is organized by members of the Regents’ and Chancellor’s Scholars Association, the recipients of the highest university honor awarded to undergraduate students.

faq.title: How are attendees selected?
faq.copy: Anyone can register for TEDxBerkeley with the purchase of a ticket. Tickets are available on Eventbrite. Be on the lookout for promotional codes on our Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/TEDxBerkeley) and Twitter (https://twitter.com/tedxberkeley) pages!

faq.title: Can I volunteer for TEDxBerkeley?
faq.copy: Short answer, no. We have filled all of our volunteer positions at this time. However, if you are a photographer or videographer interested in providing your services, please contact us at info@tedxberkeley.org with your portfolio or website.

faq.title: How do I nominate a speaker?
faq.copy: The form to nominate a speaker for TEDxBerkeley can be found by clicking here:

faq.title: How long does it take for nominations to be processed?
faq.copy: Due to the high volume of qualified nominees we receive, review by the curating team can take anywhere from two weeks up to two months.

faq.title: If I am a TEDx Organizer, can I get a special discount?
faq.copy: Yes, TEDx Organizers are eligible for up to 3 tickets at a 50% discount. University Organizers are eligible for up to 5 tickets at the student price. Email info@tedxberkeley.org for details.

faq.title: I’m a Student from another school. Can I get a discount?
faq.copy: Yes, limited student tickets are available, email registration@tedxberkeley.org for more information.

faq.title: Who should I talk to for Media/Press related matters?
faq.copy: Please contact our Media Contact, Renee Blodgett at renee@magicsaucemedia.com with any media related questions.

why.title: Why
why.content: The core of a TEDx event combines live speakers, performers and TEDTalks to spark deep discussions and connections. The immersive and uplifting event can be a life-changing experience. TEDxBerkeley 2015 will provide a platform for the Bay Area’s leading visionaries and storytellers to speak to an energised group of thinkers, as well as to the world at large. At this event, 1000 changemakers, innovators, thinkers, creatives, cultural leaders & social pioneers will witness a back-to-back schedule of talks, performances and other multimedia surprises showcasing: pioneering technologies, fresh thinking and new ideas that will foster creativity and action around the world.

where.title: Where
where.content: TEDxBerkeley will take place inside Zellerbach Hall, the premiere performance venue for Cal Performance and the greater Berkeley community. Designed by award-winning architect Vernon DeMars, the facility has hosted world-class performances in music, dance, theater, and opera, and will serve as the perfect venue for TEDxBerkeley.

what.title: What
what.content: A full day’s worth of speaker presentations and live performances at UC Berkeley to create a TED-like experience. Everyone involved will be encouraged to discuss the ideas and themes that develop throughout the day. These will be documented in real time and online via aggregated social media commentary. Each presentation will be filmed using multiple cameras for editing and uploading to the official TEDx Youtube channel after the event. The best of the presentations  will be submitted to TED in New York for consideration as TED Talks and potential posting to TED.com, translation into multiple languages for the fast-expanding and global TED.com community.

forwhom.title: For Whom
forwhom.content: Attendance at TEDxBerkeley is open to anyone who wishes to attend by purchasing a ticket here. We’re seeking to bring together outstanding students, storied professors, inspiring entrepreneurs, forward thinkers, radical architects, intriguing designers, brilliant scientists,and astounding performers who make Berkeley and the Bay Area one of the most exciting and promising regions in the world.
